title: siliconharbour.dev Content Platform Expansion
description:
Transform the events-only site into a comprehensive St. John's tech community hub.

## Content Types
- Events (existing)
- Companies - local tech companies
- Groups - meetups, communities, organizations  
- Learning - educational institutions (MUN, CNA, Keyin, Get Coding, etc.)
- People - tech community members
- News - announcements, articles
- Jobs - employment opportunities

## Core Features
- Markdown-first content authoring
- [[reference]] linking system (Obsidian-style) for cross-referencing entities
- RSS feeds per content type + combined 'all' feed
- iCal feeds for events
- Affiliations: Companies/People/Learning can be linked to Events, News can reference any entity

## Technical Approach
- Drizzle ORM with SQLite
- Raw markdown storage (no WYSIWYG)
- Bidirectional link resolution
close_reason: Completed full content platform implementation with all content types, admin interfaces, and public navigation

title: Design unified content schema
description:
Design the database schema for all content types with a unified approach.

## Tables to create:
- companies (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, location, founded, etc.)
- groups (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, meetup_frequency, etc.)
- learning (id, slug, name, description, website, logo, type enum: university/college/bootcamp/online)
- people (id, slug, name, bio, website, avatar, social_links json)
- news (id, slug, title, content, published_at, author)
- jobs (id, slug, title, description, company_id, location, remote, salary_range, posted_at, expires_at)

## Common patterns:
- All content has: id, slug, markdown content, created_at, updated_at
- All content can have: external_link, cover_image, icon_image
- Consider a polymorphic 'references' table for [[link]] relationships

## Considerations:
- Slugs for URL-friendly identifiers
- Markdown content stored as text
- References extracted and stored for bidirectional linking
close_reason: Schema designed and pushed to database. Added: companies, groups, learning, people, news, jobs tables. Added references table for [[link]] system with indexes. Added slug field to events.

title: Implement [[reference]] linking system
description:
Create a system for Obsidian-style [[reference]] links in markdown content.

## Requirements:
- Parse markdown content for [[EntityName]] patterns
- Store references in a dedicated table (source_type, source_id, target_type, target_id)
- Resolve references to actual entities by name/slug
- Support bidirectional queries (what links to X, what does X link to)
- Render [[references]] as clickable links in the UI

## Implementation:
1. Create 'references' table
2. Create parser utility to extract [[references]] from markdown
3. Create resolver to match references to entities
4. Hook into content save to update references
5. Create query helpers for bidirectional lookups
6. Create markdown renderer component that converts [[ref]] to links
close_reason: Implemented [[reference]] linking system: parser to extract refs from markdown, resolver to match refs to entities, CRUD helpers for references table, RichMarkdown component for rendering, bidirectional lookup queries, slug generation utility, and updated events to use slugs and sync references.
